title: Fish Tacos

ingredients.content: ½ oz lime peel, thin peel only, no pith (approx. 2 limes)
1 ¼ tsp fine sea salt, divided
1 ¼ tsp ground black pepper, divided
½ oz fresh parsley, leaves and tender stems
24 oz firm white fish fillets (e.g. tilapia, halibut, cod)
1 jalapeño pepper, large (stem and seeds removed)

preparations.content: Place lime peel, 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of bowl with spatula.

Add parsley, garlic, oil, lime juice, cumin and paprika and mix <b>1 min 30 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer marinade to a large zip lock bag and add fish, making sure fish is fully coated. Seal bag and set aside to marinate (see Tip). Clean mixing bowl.
Place cabbage, carrot and jalapeño into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place mayonnaise, yogurt, honey, vinegar, ¼ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.

Evenly distribute marinated fish into Varoma dish and tray. Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>15-20 min/Varoma/speed 1<b> until fish is cooked to your liking.
Meanwhile heat tortillas and keep warm. Divide the fish among the tortillas and top generously with shredded cabbage and a drizzle of reserved sauce. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: The fish can marinate for about 15-20 minutes at room temperature, but any longer would require refrigeration. Fish and shellfish should marinate for only 30 minutes to an hour; any longer and the flesh might start to “cook” and become mushy.
Serve with rice, beans and plenty of lime wedges.
Wash lemons and all vegetables not to be peeled.

The sauce and shredded cabbage can be made ahead and refrigerated until needed. Store sauce in an airtight jar. For the cabbage, place in a bowl and cover with a wet paper towel to prevent from drying out.
